TopicTitle: Show off your awesome KSP pictures!

Articles.Content: Well this is fun....

Soyuz... again!

Ridin' the Proton
Back to Kerbin or Bust:

It was all perfect, except the front wheel broke upon landing.

On the transfer to duna, I almost missed the window, and had to improvise (without mechjeb, mind you!). But I with only a little fuel left I managed to get this thing into the atmosphere and pop the parachutes.

Turns out, the atmosphere is thinner on duna, so I touched down at 12 m/s and broke a wheel.

Still, first duna voyage. Sweet.

My adventures in less practical but more beautiful looking ships.

That last one is damn sexy.

Any love for artificial [g]ravity?

how u make the picture moving?
anyone know the coordinates of the kraken on bop? if ur allowed to tell?
My new station It also features docking ports for Soyuz/Kliper (small arm) and Buran (large arm). It's not yet completed,but i'm getting there.

My Delta II rocket. This thing has 6 solid boosters attached radially.

A Delta II has 3,4, or 9 boosters.

I <3 Proton

No, he took 1000 screenshots, then made them into a gif.

how do you make those badge things appear under your comment?

I have started my base on Duna and the first delivery is a Truck. Its a multipurpose truck, refueling, pulling stuff say payloads from my Falcon X Jumbo Transporter etc. Basically gonna use it to construct and move the base when needed and also Refuel Spaceplanes if needed. My Falcon X Jumbo Transport have none stop range to Duna and back (Laythe to) but I figure it could be useful to be able to load/unload the Jumbo if needed. One reason for refueling could be a payload delivery to Duna then going to Laythe and pick or move some of my stuff there for example.

The Truck is 43.26 Tons and thats a record payload for me for a nonstop flight with out refueling to Duna. But I did run out of jet fuel before the engines would have flamed out when climbing in Kerbins atmosphere causing higher oxidizer burn and I had almost no fuel for landing once back from Duna but I did make it.

One of the Kerbal crew members had to go and fix a flat on the Truck before unloading.

I also hope we get some resource management soon sens its pretty boring flying in all the fuel when Duna seems to have water at its poles that could turn in to hydrogen and oxygen.

Edited May 9, 2013 by pa1983

The real question is, why do the spinning artificial gravity modules have windows on what would be the floor?

...Modern architecture...

Spirit of Prescott, my second SSTMO bus, is Mun-bound.

Closing on MOSS.

Then I was like...whoa...

Meanwhile, on the surface at Lonely Outpost.

MOSS with Spirit of Prescott docked on the bottom of the main hub. Above is the first crew rotation shuttle. The end node is occupied by a failed Mun bus (not enough thrust to land). Currently being used as fuel storage.

I have started my base on Duna and the first delivery is a Truck. Its a multipurpose truck, refueling, pulling stuff say payloads from my Falcon X Jumbo Transporter etc. Basically gonna use it to construct and move the base when needed and also Refuel Spaceplanes if needed. My Falcon X Jumbo Transport have none stop range to Duna and back (Laythe to) but I figure it could be useful to be able to load/unload the Jumbo if needed. One reason for refueling could be a payload delivery to Duna then going to Laythe and pick or move some of my stuff there for example.

The Truck is 43.26 Tons and thats a record payload for me for a nonstop flight with out refueling to Duna. But I did run out of jet fuel before the engines would have flamed out when climbing in Kerbins atmosphere causing higher oxidizer burn and I had almost no fuel for landing once back from Duna but I did make it.

One of the Kerbal crew members had to go and fix a flat on the Truck before unloading.

I also hope we get some resource management soon sens its pretty boring flying in all the fuel when Duna seems to have water at its poles that could turn in to hydrogen and oxygen.

I can say that you're a professional KSP player.

No, he took 1000 screenshots, then made them into a gif.

You're not familiar with what is called sarcasm, are you ?
To get it that smooth, I assume he captured a video, and turned that into a gif.
Today I explored an interesting part of the least visited planet
Wow. I've wondered about that river. I'm so going there next.

First (Return Manned) Mission to Duna. 17.0.

Mothership orbited outside Duna, lander deorbited.

Fuel was close... only the best pilot could pull off the mission..... but somehow co-planar orbit was attained with 0.34% fuel remaining in the lander. The Mothership managed to slowly thrust over to the lander, and our brave pilot Engles Kerman rejoins the crew.... (honestly the scariest 5 minutes of my life, from liftofff of Duna to rendezvous).

[h=1][/h]

After watching the Orion Project Documentary, I set myself to build an SSTO that kinda looked like a Bullet shaped Spaceship. And here it is.

The KX-Deuterios I landed on the north pole of Kerbin.
